intro: Borreria exigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Borreria exigua is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
